intro: Plagiobothrys figuratus subsp. figuratus, commonly known as the Figuratus bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. This subspecies is characterized by its small, showy white flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open areas with well-drained soil. The plant is known for its distinctive seed pods that remain attached to the plant even after the flowers have faded.
